materials.raw_text: K: 10 g, Na: 20 g, P: 45 g, Rb: 15 g, Si: 30 g

sourcing.instructions: K (Potassium) - Purchase from a chemical supply store; Na (Sodium) - Obtain sodium metal from a chemical vendor; P (Phosphorus) - Buy red phosphorus from a chemical supplier; Rb (Rubidium) - Acquire rubidium chloride from a specialized supplier; Si (Silicon) - Buy silicon powder from a material supply store.
steps: K (Potassium) - Purchase from a chemical supply store; Na (Sodium) - Obtain sodium metal from a chemical vendor; P (Phosphorus) - Buy red phosphorus from a chemical supplier; Rb (Rubidium) - Acquire rubidium chloride from a specialized supplier; Si (Silicon) - Buy silicon powder from a material supply store.

1. Measure each ingredient using an analytical balance for precision. 2. In a clean, dry glass container, combine 10 g of K, 20 g of Na, 45 g of P, 15 g of Rb, and 30 g of Si. 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer for at least 10 minutes to ensure homogeneity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure each ingredient using an analytical balance for precision. 2. In a clean, dry glass container, combine 10 g of K, 20 g of Na, 45 g of P, 15 g of Rb, and 30 g of Si. 3. Mix the powders thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer for at least 10 minutes to ensure homogeneity.

steps: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 800째C. 2. Transfer the mixed powders into a silica crucible. 3. Place the crucible into the furnace and hold at 800째C for 2 hours.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 800째C. 2. Transfer the mixed powders into a silica crucible. 3. Place the crucible into the furnace and hold at 800째C for 2 hours.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Once cool, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Once cool, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible and inspect for cracks or defects. 2. If necessary, sand down any rough edges using fine-grit sandpaper. 3. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear epoxy resin to enhance durability and protect the material. 4. Allow the epoxy to cure for 24 hours at room temperature.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible and inspect for cracks or defects. 2. If necessary, sand down any rough edges using fine-grit sandpaper. 3. Optionally, seal the surface with a clear epoxy resin to enhance durability and protect the material. 4. Allow the epoxy to cure for 24 hours at room temperature.
